bill.title: Relating To Vacant And Abandoned Residential Property.
bill.description: Requires counties to establish expedited procedures to approve demolition permits for vacant and abandoned residential homes. Allows the department of taxation to seek sale of the property through nonjudicial foreclosure of vacant and abandoned residential properties with outstanding recorded state tax liens at any time after establishing vacancy and abandonment. Takes effect 1/28/2081. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to JUD, FIN, referral sheet 3
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Wednesday, 02-13-19 2:01PM in House conference room 325.
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-14-19.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Thursday, 02-14-19 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) C. Lee, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Lowen, McKelvey, Morikawa, Takayama, Yamane, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Say; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 737) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to FIN.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on FIN with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Aquino, DeCoite, Nakamura, Quinlan, Thielen excused (5).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Tuesday, 02-26-19 12:30PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Eli, Gates, Hashimoto, Holt, Kitagawa, B. Kobayashi, Matayoshi, Nakamura, Nishimoto, Todd, Wildberger, Yamashita, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1135), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 155).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDC/WAM.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-19 1:20PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in PSM were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Wakai, Baker; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Harimoto, Fevella.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1409) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDC/WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDC/WAM.
Carried over to 2020 Regular Session.
